title: Drawing, "Harrison, Fouilhoux,  American Radiator: Table", February 12, 1937
medium: Graphite, red color pencil, and black ink on tracing paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower center: DONALD DESKEY/630 FIFTH AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite in stamp, lower center: 8553/F.S./HARRISON, GARTNER/OLSSON/FEB 12, 1937, 2/13/37, 1, PETROWSKI/2/15/37, 1, MASTERCR.; inscribed in graphite above stamp: ONE TABLE  4'-0" DIA./BRAZ. ROSEWOOD TOP./POL. CHROM LEGS. 1 1/2" SQUARE TUBES/TWO TURNABLE ASHTRAY WITH REMOVABLE SPINNING/TWO TURNABLE PHONE SHELVES/WITH ROSEWOOD TOP/PROVIDE INLET & OUTLET HOLE FOR/PHONE WIRE ON TWO LEGS; dimensions, materials, instructions in graphite
description: Perspective, plan, and elevation drawings for circular table in Brazilian rosewood. Top of table in rosewood with four square tube legs in polished chrome. Two turnable ashtrys attached below surface of table on legs on opposite sides with removable spinning (?). Two turnable phone trays affixed below surface on legs on opposite sides with rosewood surface. Phone wires in two legs.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Harrison, Fouilhoux,  American Radiator: Table", February 12, 1937.Graphite, red color pencil, and black ink on tracing paper. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-979.
